column5: Interpublic Group names Philippe Krakowsky as CEO
column6: (Reuters) - Interpublic Group IPG.N said on Wednesday it has named Philippe Krakowsky as chief executive officer, effective Jan. 1, 2021.
column7: Michael Roth, the current Chairman and CEO will remain in his current role until then and will become Executive Chairman of the board next year, the advertising firm said in a statement.

column4: Interpublic Group posts 8.7% rise in revenue
column5: (Reuters) - Interpublic Group of Cos Inc IPG.N reported an 8.7% jump in quarterly net revenue on Tuesday, as the U.S. advertising company benefited from higher client spending.
column6: Net income available to the company’s common stockholders rose to $165.6 million, or 42 cents per share, in the third quarter ended Sept. 30, from $161 million, or 41 cents per share, a year earlier.
column7: Net revenue rose to $2.06 billion from $1.89 billion.

column4: Ad firm Interpublic's net revenue rises 9.1% on higher client spending
column5: July 23 (Reuters) - U.S. advertising firm Interpublic Group of Cos Inc reported a 9.1% rise in quarterly revenue on Tuesday, boosted by higher client spending worldwide.
column6: Net income available to Interpublic’s common stockholders’ rose to $169.5 million, or 43 cents per share, in the three months ended June 30 from $145.8 million, or 37 cents a share, a year earlier.
column7: Net revenue rose to $2.13 billion from $1.95 billion. (Reporting by Sayanti Chakraborty in Bengaluru; Editing by Rashmi Aich)

column4: Ad firm Interpublic's net revenue rises 13 pct
column5: April 26 (Reuters) - U.S. advertising firm Interpublic Group of Cos Inc reported a 13 percent rise in quarterly revenue on Friday, boosted by higher client spending worldwide.
column6: Net loss available to the company’s common stockholders narrowed to $8 million, or 2 cents per share, in the first quarter ended March 31, from $14.1 million, or 4 cents per share, a year earlier.
column7: Net revenue rose 13 percent to $2 billion. (Reporting by Akanksha Rana in Bengaluru; Editing by Maju Samuel)

column4: Ad firm Interpublic's revenue jumps 10 pct in fourth quarter
column5: Feb 13 (Reuters) - Interpublic Group’s quarterly revenue rose 10.3 percent, the U.S. advertising firm said on Wednesday, as it benefits from higher client spending worldwide.
column6: Net income available to the company’s common stockholders rose to $326.2 million or 84 cents per share in the fourth quarter ended Dec. 31, from $252.3 million or 64 cents per share a year earlier.
column7: Total revenue rose to $2.86 billion from $2.59 billion. (Reporting by Akanksha Rana in Bengaluru; Editing by Sai Sachin Ravikumar)

column4: Ad firm Interpublic revenue rises 4 pct
column5: Oct 19 (Reuters) - U.S advertising firm Interpublic Group reported a 4 percent rise in quarterly revenue on Friday, helped by higher client spending worldwide.
column6: Net income available to the company’s common stockholders fell to $161 million, or 41 cents per share, in the third quarter ended Sept. 30, from $169.7 million, or 43 cents per share, a year earlier.
column7: Total revenue rose to $2.30 billion from $2.21 billion.

column4: Ad group Interpublic's profit rises 35 percent
column5: July 24 (Reuters) - U.S. advertising firm Interpublic Group’s profit jumped 35.4 percent in the second quarter, led by higher client spending.
column6: The company said on Tuesday net income attributable to common stockholders rose to $145.8 million or 37 cents per share in the three months ended June 30, from $107.7 million or 27 cents per share a year earlier.
column7: Revenue climbed to $2.39 billion from $2.19 billion. (Reporting by Shariq Khan and Vibhuti Sharma in Bengaluru; Editing by Sai Sachin Ravikumar)

column4: CORRECTED-Acxiom to sell marketing solutions division to Interpublic for $2.3 bln
column5: (Corrects to $2.3 bln from $2.2 bln in headline)
column6: July 2 (Reuters) - Data mining firm Acxiom on Monday agreed to sell its marketing solutions division to Interpublic Group of Companies Inc for $2.3 billion in cash.
column7: The transaction is expected to close by the end of 2018, the companies said. (Reporting by Vibhuti Sharma in Bengaluru; Editing by Maju Samuel)

column4: Ad firm Interpublic's revenue rises 5 pct
column5: April 27 (Reuters) - Interpublic Group of Cos Inc reported a 5 percent rise in quarterly net revenue on Friday, as the advertising company benefited from higher client spending in the United States.
column6: The company reported a net loss available to IPG Common stockholders of $14.1 million, or 4 cents per share, in the first quarter ended March 31, compared with a profit of $24.7 million, or 6 cents per share, a year earlier.
column7: Net revenue rose to $2.17 billion from $2.06 billion. (Reporting by Shariq Khan in Bengaluru; Editing by Maju Samuel)
